SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Easily Activate Shopping Carts When Adding Items with the API

When you programmatically add items to an inactive shopping cart using the ccrz.ccApiCart.addTo() method, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now automatically enables the cart's Active Cart field.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Who: This change applies to both version 2.0 and 1.0 of the Shopping Cart page.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, an inactive cart remained inactive when items were programmatically added to it. This change reduces the complexity required to activate a cart when adding items.

How: This change applies to all ccrz.ccApiCart.addTo() calls where the input maps specify ccrz.ccApi.API_VERSION => 9 and later.

If you call this method in your subscriber code and you use the ccrz.ccApi.API_VERSION => ccrz.ccApi.CURRENT_VERSION notation, make sure that you update your code to account for this change.

If you prefer to continue using the previous behavior of this method, make sure that your subscriber code specifies ccrz.ccApi.API_VERSION => 8 or earlier.

title: Easily Activate Shopping Carts with B2B Commerce for Visualforce
